programme.title: The King's Speech
programme.desc: Oscar-winning historical drama starring Colin Firth, Helena Bonham Carter and Geoffrey Rush. As part of his royal duties, Prince Albert is required to speak at public events, a task made all the more difficult owing to his severe stammer. The death of his father and subsequent abdication of his older brother means that "Bertie" is to be crowned king. programme.title: There Will Be Blood
programme.desc: Oscar-winning period drama starring Daniel Day-Lewis and Paul Dano. In California in 1898, lone prospector Daniel Plainview strikes silver. But when that mine plays out and he discovers oil, Plainview puts his energy into becoming a powerful oilman. This leads the ruthless, self-made tycoon to travel the country buying up drilling rights at cut-rate prices. However, when he encounters the preacher Eli Sunday, the destinies of the two men will be linked for years to come Paul Thomas Anderson - Director Daniel Day-Lewis - Daniel Plainview Paul Dano - Eli Sunday / Paul Sunday Kevin J O'Connor - Henry Ciaran Hinds - Fletcher Dillon Freasier - HW Sydney McCallister - Mary Sunday David Warshofsky - HM Tilford Colton Woodward - William Bandy Colleen Foy - Adult Mary Sunday Russell Harvard - Adult HW Daniel Day-Lewis - Daniel Plainview Paul Dano - Eli Sunday / Paul Sunday Kevin J O'Connor - Henry Ciaran Hinds - Fletcher Dillon Freasier - HW Sydney McCallister - Mary Sunday David Warshofsky - HM Tilford Colton Woodward - William Bandy Colleen Foy - Adult Mary Sunday Russell Harvard - Adult HW.

programme.title: To Catch a Killer
programme.desc: Eleanor is a talented but troubled young rookie detective wrestling with the demons of her past, when she is called to the scene of a brutal mass shooting - the work of a new and terrifying murderer. The police and FBI launch a nationwide manhunt, but are thwarted at every turn by the killer's enigmatic, and unprecedented behaviour. programme.desc: Period comedy drama starring Paul Giamatti, Da'Vine Joy Randolph and Dominic Sessa. Paul Hunham, the crotchety classics teacher at a boys' boarding school, is tasked with supervising the students who have been forced to stay on campus during the Christmas break. programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Kate Winslet. As the Second World War rages, American fashion model-turned-photographer Elizabeth "Lee" Miller defies the expectations of the era and travels to mainland Europe as a war correspondent for Vogue. programme.desc: United Archives 6/2/99. Former United boss Ron Atkinson was hoping to get one over his old club when they visited the City Ground with Forest deep in relegation trouble.

programme.title: PL: United v Everton 99/00
programme.desc: United Archives 4/12/99. The Intercontinental Cup champions return from Japan to put five goals past Everton, with Ole Gunnar Solskjaer grabbing four of them.

programme.title: PL: United v Southampton 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 28/10/00. United welcomed struggling Southampton looking to keep up their scintillating home form, having scored 22 goals in their opening six league contests at the Theatre of Dreams.

programme.title: PL: United v Arsenal 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 25/2/01. United welcomed Arsenal knowing that victory would move them closer to securing a third consecutive Premiership crown.

programme.title: PL United v Southampton 01/02
programme.desc: United Archives 22/12/01. Sir Alex's side took on Southampton with the visitors looking for their first win at Old Trafford since January 1988.

programme.title: PL: United v Newcastle 02/03
programme.desc: United Archives 23/11/02. Ruud Van Nistelrooy makes the headlines in this game full of goals.

programme.desc: United Archives 2/4/11. Wayne Rooney scores a second half hat-trick as United comeback to win at Upton Park in one of the games of the season.

programme.title: PL: United v Arsenal 11/12
programme.desc: United Archives 28/8/11. The Reds welcomed an Arsenal side who had made a slow start to the season. With the Gunners hampered by injuries and suspensions, could Sir Alex's men take advantage?

programme.title: PL: Bolton v United 11/12
programme.desc: United Archives 10/9/11. United enjoyed a stellar start to the 2011/12 season, underlined at The Reebok Stadium with a 5 star performance against Bolton.

programme.title: PL: United v Wigan 11/12
programme.desc: United Archives 26/12/11. The Reds welcomed Wigan hoping to make it a Christmas to remember by recording a fifth straight Premier League win.

programme.title: PL: United v Norwich 12/13
programme.desc: United Archives 2/3/13. Norwich were the last team to beat the Reds in the Barclays Premier League back in November. Could the Canaries pull off another shock result?

programme.desc: United Archives 22/4/13. Defeat for Manchester City against Tottenham meant that a win would secure the Reds a historic 20th league title, could they see off Aston Villa?
